intro: Hippocratea rowlandii, commonly known as the Rowland's hippocratea, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the dry season. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and it typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils. It is a shrub that can reach up to 2 meters in height, and it is adapted to the cool, humid climates of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
